page.title: 06Transport - Railways
page.content:
The railway which runs partially through the d-block forms a part of the commuter system of Southern Region into Waterloo. Originally, the line belonged to the London & South Western Railway Company. The building of the railway was initially blocked by the Town Elders, but by 1849 the railway reached Chertsey as a branch from Weybridge. The loop was completed in 1870 to Virginia Water joining the Reading line.
Today, the frequency of trains is half-hourly which link to the Main lines at Weybridge and Virginia Water. Many people using the train today prefer to travel from Woking or Staines to London, as the journey time is drastically reduced, and service frequency increased.
